data.content:
Từ điển Anh - Việt
◘[weif]
*danh từ
 ■(hàng hải) vật trôi giạt (ở bờ biển)
 ■vật vô chủ
 ■người lang thang, trẻ bị bỏ rơi, trẻ bơ vơ
 ▸waifs and strays
 ■trẻ bơ vơ sống nơi đầu đường xó chợ
 ■chó mèo vô chủ

Anh - Anh
waif
■ noun a homeless and helpless person, especially a neglected or abandoned child.
⁃ a person who appears thin or poorly nourished.
Derivatives
waifishadjective
waiflikeadjective
Word History
Waif comes from Old Northern French gaif, which was probably from a Scandinavian root meaning 'something loose or wandering'. In medieval English it was a legal term used in the phrase waif and stray to refer to an unclaimed item of property or a stray animal. By the late 18th century waif had assumed its modern meaning. The verb waive is related to waif: it comes from Old French gaiver 'allow to become a waif, abandon', and was originally a legal term.

Từ điển Đồng nghĩa
waif
▸ noun RAGAMUFFIN, urchin; foundling, orphan, stray; derogatory guttersnipe; dated gamin.

sentences.en: They looked thin, waif - like and half starved.
sentences.vi: Chúng trông gầy, giống như trẻ bơ vơ và sắp chết đói.

sentences.en: They looked thin, waif-like and half starved.
sentences.vi: Chúng trông gầy, giống như trẻ bơ vơ và sắp chết đói.

sentences.en: She never failed to remind young Mark, if it hadn't been for her generosity, he would be a vagrant, homeless waif.
sentences.vi: Bà ấy lúc nào cũng nhắc nhở cậu bé Mark rằng nếu không có sự nhân từ rộng lựơng của bà thì cậu đã trở thành một đứa trẻ lang thang đầu đường xó chợ.
